description.raw:
See issue #53. 

I just replaced the call `std::exit` with a `return`. We could raise an exception but this constructor is triggered in the `Node` constructor, which is highly used. Having to wrap the `Node` constructor every time you use with a `try/catch` looks really inconvenient to me but other suggestions are welcome.

CI results:

* [Trusty](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ignition/job/ignition_transport-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64/150) :large_blue_circle:
* [Homebrew](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ignition/job/ignition_transport-ci-pr_any-homebrew-amd64/153) :large_blue_circle:
* [Windows](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ignition/job/ignition_transport-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/288) :large_blue_circle:
* [ABI checker](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/ignition/job/ignition_transport-abichecker-any_to_any-xenial-amd64/16) :large_blue_circle:
